meanings.definition: Lacking in some necessary quality or element.
meanings.sent1: The soup was deficient in salt, making it bland.
meanings.sent2: Her deficient knowledge of math made it hard for her to solve the problem.
meanings.sent3: The team's deficient performance in the game was like a car running on empty.
meanings.sent4: His deficient skills in painting left the canvas looking unfinished.
meanings.sent5: The deficient light in the room made it difficult to see clearly.

meanings.sent1: The small portion of food was deficient for his hunger.
meanings.sent2: Her deficient savings were not enough to cover the unexpected expense.
meanings.sent3: The deficient rainfall left the plants thirsty for more.
meanings.sent4: His deficient speed in the race cost him the first place.
meanings.sent5: The deficient number of chairs in the room made it hard for everyone to sit.

meanings.definition: Not meeting the requirements or standards.
meanings.sent1: His deficient essay did not fulfill the assignment's guidelines.
meanings.sent2: The deficient quality of the product led to many customer complaints.
meanings.sent3: The deficient costume at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her deficient attendance at work resulted in a warning from her boss.
meanings.sent5: The deficient score on the test made him realize he needed to study more.
